name: C. Mushroom Gnomes - 2
statement:
One day Natalia was walking in the woods when she met a little mushroom
gnome. The gnome told her the following story:Everybody knows that the
mushroom gnomes’ power lies in the magic mushrooms that grow in the
native woods of the gnomes. There are trees and magic mushrooms in the
woods: the -th tree grows at a point on a straight line with coordinates
and has the height of , the -th mushroom grows at the point with
coordinates and has magical powers .But one day wild mushroommunchers,
the sworn enemies of mushroom gnomes unleashed a terrible storm on their
home forest. As a result, some of the trees began to fall and crush the
magic mushrooms. The supreme oracle of mushroom gnomes calculated in
advance the probability for each tree that it will fall to the left, to
the right or will stand on. If the tree with the coordinate and height
falls to the left, then all the mushrooms that belong to the right-open
interval , are destroyed. If a tree falls to the right, then the
mushrooms that belong to the left-open interval are destroyed. Only
those mushrooms that are not hit by a single tree survive.Knowing that
all the trees fall independently of each other (i.e., all the events are
mutually independent, and besides, the trees do not interfere with other
trees falling in an arbitrary direction), the supreme oracle was also
able to quickly calculate what would be the expectation of the total
power of the mushrooms which survived after the storm. His calculations
ultimately saved the mushroom gnomes from imminent death.Natalia, as a
good Olympiad programmer, got interested in this story, and she decided
to come up with a way to quickly calculate the expectation of the sum of
the surviving mushrooms’ power.
